message: I just recently created a new app for Facebook on helping me find new books to read and hopefully some of you will find it useful too.  http://apps.facebook.com/newprogrammingbooks/
I would also appreciate any feedback on how I can improve it.
@C_t_Montgomery would be able to send me a screen shot of what you are getting?
I keep getting an application error when trying to login...
I do like the concept though - it'd be a nice thing to know.
@danest sure, here you go: http://bit.ly/eXgx0p
@C_t_Montgomery thanks for the image I have no clue what the error is about. I will look at my heroku logs and try to replicate the error.
@C_t_Montgomery I have tried to get the same error but I have gotten nothing. Did you have javascript disabled when you tried to log in? Is anyone else getting this same error?
@danest Nope, I definitely had js enabled. Still getting the error now...
@C_t_Montgomery I am still looking at my logs but I am having trouble finding it.

@danes hmm. yeah - just tried it in Safari, Chrome, and Firefox (all the latest stable versions) on OS X and still getting that error. Tried logging out of fb and back in, but I guess it's just me... :(
@danest What plugins did you use for that? Did you find any good resources for writing Facebook apps with Rails?
i"m not getting the error, but I'm being asked to accept a connection without ssl. not very comfortable with that :)
@digiberber yea I need to work on trying to get it with an ssl
@scottweisman I just use omniauth gem for the application and then just standard rails app
pretty cool concept, can you sort them out into categories? that'll be really useful. and perhaps add a search tool?just to make it easier for your users to get what they want quick.
I like your app too, thank you! I'll definitely be checking it over time.
can you use this for your app's ssl : http://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/ssl#piggyback_ssl_myappherokucom_only ?

@dench Yea I am currently working on adding more categories so it is easier to search and also so that it is not just programming related(gardening,classics..etc), I will add a search option as well too.
@misterinterrupt Thanks for this, I have just enabled it on my application and hopefully it works.
